intro: Hepetis laxissima, commonly known as the slender larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other showy and sometimes toxic plants. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hepetis laxissima typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas.
